intro: Neopallasia, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plants are characterized by their heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Neopallasia species are often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and abandoned fields. They play a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various insects and birds.
